TextBody:
Hello Indu,

Thank you for contacting our Support Department.

Are you able to connect on those endpoints and perform the following commands: 
ping IP of the EPP server
telnet IP of the EPP server

What messages do you receive after you run the commands? 

What is the client version that you installed on the machines ? 

Looking forward for your response.

Best regards,
__________________
Daniel Anton | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | MDM | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
www.endpointprotector.com

daniel.anton@endpointprotector.com

Subject: Host is not syncing with EPP portal.    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0CGKYX:ref ]

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000CGKYX:ref

Hi Daniel,

I executed the commands but failed to connect to the EPP server IP .  
Installed agent version: 6.2.2.1.006

However, after manually reinstalling the EPP agent, it is now functioning correctly. Our Intune policy is designed to deploy the EPP agent, yet it seems to be ineffective when distributed through Intune. 

Please review the following information. Should you desire a call, kindly arrange a time between 10 AM and 8 PM IST. 

Thanks,
Indu
Subject: Netwrix Support Ticket #412902 - Host is not syncing with EPP portal.

TextBody:
Hello Indu, 

Thank you for getting back to us.

Could you please provide us the error that you receive while you tried to run the commands? 

If there is a communication issue, most likely this will affect the INTUNE deployment. 

Looking forward for your response. 

Best regards,

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000CGKYX:ref

Hey Daniel, 

I've also verified the telnet connection, but regrettably, the server remains inaccessible. It's perplexing that the issue resolves when the agent is manually installed on the user's machine.
Subject: Netwrix Support Ticket #412902 - Host is not syncing with EPP portal.

TextBody:
Hello Indu,

Thank you for getting back to us. 

In that case, it seems that there is a misconfiguration when that EPP client was deployed, or the client didn't install correctly.

To check if the client is communicating with the server you can follow the next steps: 

	open the epp client 
	navigate to Settings menu
	press CTRL + ALT + I keys from your keyboard

If you do not see any results, that means there is an issue with the communication.

Looking forward for your response.

Best regards,
__________________
Daniel Anton | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | MDM | Device Control | Content Aware Protection

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000CGKYX:ref

Hi Daniel,

I wanted to provide an update on the current situation regarding Intune policies. Upon checking with other devices, I have found that the policies are working correctly on Mac devices. However, the same policies do not seem to be effective on Windows devices.

We do not believe this issue is related to DNS, as we have ensured that the epp domain and URL are allowed through our proxy.

I would appreciate any guidance or support you can provide to help resolve this issue.

Thanks,
Indu

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000CGKYX:ref

Hi Daniel,

We are awaiting your response! 

We have hosted our server from cososys ( netwrix ), As discussed, we should not get the notification of Security Update – EPP Server Hotfix #1.1 – Important Security Updates for EPP Server, However, even after upgarding it, i could still able to see the notification. 

Attached screenshot of the notification which is appearing on dashboard to update the s/w.  

Thanks,
Indu
Subject: Netwrix Support Ticket #412902 - Host is not syncing with EPP portal.

TextBody:
Hi Indu,

Thank you for your email.
We are aware of the issue, where even after applied the hotfix lingers in the list of available updates.
You can disregard this for now, it will be fixed and if applied the update will be gone coming the next server version release.

Adrian Stanca
Technical Support Engineer

DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | Enforced Encryption | eDiscovery
Email | Website | LinkedIn
